home_energy_hub_global_settings.title: BMS Connector - First Run Setup
home_energy_hub_global_settings.description: Welcome to the BMS Connector Addon. This entry must be completed and added before you can continue to use this addon.

data.disclaimer: This add-on is designed for informational and control purposes only. Any electrical installations or adjustments should only be carried out by qualified professionals. It's essential to ensure that all devices connected to this add-on have the appropriate safety configurations in place. By checking this box, you acknowledge and accept that the developers hold no liability for any damage or issues that may result from the use of this add-on.
data.anon_reporting_confirm: (Optional) We may in the future start collecting anonymous usage data for statistical reports, if you would like to enable this for this entry please opt in by ticking the box.

seplos_bms_v2_device.description: Please enter the connection port and select the number of battery packs are attached to your BMS. For example, use '/dev/ttyUSB0' for USB serial connections and select 1 for a single battery.

seplos_bms_v2.description: Please enter the connection port and battery address for your BMS. For example, use '/dev/ttyUSB0' for USB serial connections and '0x00' for a single battery.

bms_type.description: Please select your BMS Version from the list below. If your BMS is not listed, it is currently not supported. You can request support on our GitHub repository.

connector_port.description: Please enter the connection port for your BMS. For example, use '/dev/ttyUSB0' for local serial connections. ESPHome and Bluetooth connection ports may be available in the future.

sensor_prefix.description: Please enter your battery address and desired sensor naming prefix. All sensors will automatically include the battery address as part of their names and cannot be removed.

data.battery_address: Please enter your battery pack address
data.sensor_prefix: Please enter your desired sensor prefix
